gurmukhi: jy jy hoq Asur blvwnw ] riv mwrq iqn ko ibiD nwnw ]
transliteration: Je Je Hot Asur Balvaanaa|| Rav(i) Maarat Tin Ko Bidh(i) Naanaa||
translation: Wherever the demons become Lord, Vishnu manifested himself as Suraj incarnation kills them in different ways.

gurmukhi: AMDkwr DrnI qy hry ] pRjw kwj giH ky auiT pry ]2]
transliteration: Andhkaar Dharnite Dare|| Prajaa Kaaj Grih Ke Outh(i) Dare||2||
translation: The sun destroyed the darkness from the earth and in order to give comfort to the subjects, he used to roam hither and thither.2.

gurmukhi: ibswr AwlsM sBY pRBwq log jwghIN ] AnMq jwp ko jpYN ibAMq DXwn pwghIN ]
transliteration: Bisaar Aalsan Sabhai Prabhaat Log Jaag-heen|| Anant Jaap Ko Japaeen Beant Dhyaan Paag-heen||
translation: (Seeing the Sun,) all the people abandoned idleness and woke up at dawn and meditating on the Omnipresent Lord, used to repeat His Name in various ways.

gurmukhi: durMq krm ko krYN AQwp Qwp QwphIN ] gwieqRI sMiDXwn kY Ajwp jwp jwphI ]3]
transliteration: Durant Karam Ko Darain Athaap Thaap Thaap-heen|| Gadetrisandhiyaan Kai Ajaap Jaap Jaap-heen||3||
translation: Working on difficult jobs, they used to stablise in their mind the Uninstallable Lord and used to recite the Gyatri and Sandhya.3.

gurmukhi: su dyv krm Awid lY pRBwq jwg kY krYN ] su j`g DUp dIp hom byd ibXwkrn rrYN ]
transliteration: Su Dev Karam Aadh Lai Prabhaat Jaag Kai Darain|| Su Jagg Dhoop Deep Hom Bed Biyaakaran Darain||
translation: All the people, repeating the name of the Lord, used to perform godly deeds and also reflected on the Vedas and Vyakarna etc. alongwith the burning of incense, lighting the earthen lamps and performing Yajnas.

gurmukhi: su ipqR krm hYN ijqy so biRqbiRq ko krYN ] ju swsqR ismiRiq aucrMq su Drm DXwn ko DrYN ]4]
transliteration: Su Pitra Karam Hain Jite So Brit-brit Ko Darain|| Ju Saastra Simrit(i) Ouchran Su Dharam Dhyaan Ko Ddarain||
translation: They used to perform rituals for the manes according to their power and used to concentrate on virtuous actions alongwith the recitation of Shastras, Smritis etc.4.

gurmukhi: su DUMm DUMm hI ] krMq sYn BUMm hI ]
transliteration: Su Dhoonm Dhoonm Hee|| Karant Sain Bhoonm Hee||
translation: The smoke of Yajnas was visible on all the four sides and all the people slept on the earth.

gurmukhi: ibAMq DXwn DXwvhIN ] durMq Taur pwvhIN ]5]
transliteration: Beant Dhyaan Dhyaav-heen|| Durant Thaur Paav-heen||5||
translation: Performing mediation and worship in many ways, they used to work for the growth of distant places.5.

gurmukhi: AnMq mMqR aucrYN ] su jog jwpnw krYN ]
transliteration: Anant Mantra Ouchrain|| Su Jog Jaapnaa Darain||
translation: Reciting many mantras, the people performed Yogic discipline and repeated the Name.

gurmukhi: niRbwn purK DXwvhIN ] ibmwn AMiq pwvhIN ]6]
transliteration: Nribaan Purakh Dhyaav-heen|| Bimaan Ant(i) Paav-heen||6||
translation: They meditated on the Detached Supreme Purusha and ultimately they acquired the air-vehicles for transportation to heaven.6.

gurmukhi: bhuq kwl iem bIqXo krq Drmu Aru dwn ] bhuir Asuir biFXo pRbl dIrGu kwie dqu mwn ]7]
transliteration: Bahout Kaal Im Beetyo Karat Dharam(u) Ar(u) Daan|| Bahur(i) Asur(i) Badhiyo Prabal Deeragh(u) Keeaae Dat(u) Maan||7||
translation: In this way a good deal of time elapsed in performing religious and charitable actions and then a powerful demon named deeraghkaya was born.7.
